snippet: Arizona corrections officials and medical staff members routinely deviate from written rules for conducting executions, state records and court filings show.
abstract: State records and court filings show that Arizona corrections officials and medical staff routinely deviate from state's written rules for conducting executions; it is unclear if constant changes have led to cruel and unusual punishment.

byline.original: By FERNANDA SANTOS and JOHN SCHWARTZ
byline.contributor: Fernanda Santos reported from Phoenix, and John Schwartz from New York.

lead_paragraph: Arizona corrections officials and medical staff members routinely deviate from written rules for conducting executions, state records and court filings show.

headline.main: Arizona Loose With Its Rules in Executions, Records Show
headline.print_headline: Arizona Loose With Its Rules in Executions, Records Show
